name: perceivably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that can be seen, heard, or noticed: My energy levels shifted perceivably. The drop-down menu is perceivably slow.
More examplesFewer examplesIs the way a child moves perceivably different from the motion of an adult?The range of species in this area has changed perceivably towards more drought-tolerant species.The character's clothes are a reminder of the perceivably separate nature of the two worlds in the novel. Minority languages may perceivably become "inferior" to the dominant languages if they are not promoted.
